chapters.title: Excerpt
content: In a village of La Mancha, the name of which I have no desire to call to mind, there lived not long since one of those gentlemen that keep a lance in the lance-rack, an old buckler, a lean hack, and a greyhound for coursing.
An olla of rather more beef than mutton, a salad on most nights, some lean chorizo, and a pigeon or so constituted his whole diet.
He was fond of reading books of chivalry with such ardor and devotion that he almost entirely neglected the pursuit of his estate.
